docs.snippet: The opening meeting of an intended series of Temperance meetings of the Metropolitan Police in the eastern section of the City was held last evening in the Allen-street Church. Captains DE CAMP, of the Fourth Precinct, STEERS, of the Eleventh...
docs.lead_paragraph: The opening meeting of an intended series of Temperance meetings of the Metropolitan Police in the eastern section of the City was held last evening in the Allen-street Church. Captains DE CAMP, of the Fourth Precinct, STEERS, of the Eleventh Precinct, and HARTT, of the Seventeenth Precinct, and about one hundred and fifty Policemen were present, besides several hundred other persons interested in the movement.

docs.snippet: COMMISSIONER OF JURORS.--The board appointed by the act framed last Winter with power to appoint a Commissioner of Jurors, have finally, after several meetings, agreed upon WILLIAM H. CAMPBELL, the present County Clerk. The Commissioner is required...
docs.lead_paragraph: COMMISSIONER OF JURORS.--The board appointed by the act framed last Winter with power to appoint a Commissioner of Jurors, have finally, after several meetings, agreed upon WILLIAM H. CAMPBELL, the present County Clerk. The Commissioner is required to give bonds in the sum of $5,000 for the faithful discharge of his duties.

docs.snippet: LADIES' UNION AID SOCIETY.--The Ladies Union Aid Society, of the Methodist Eolscopal Church, for the benefit of aged and infirm members, held a donation party at the Institution in Forty-second-street. near the Eighth-avenue, yesterday, at 4 o'clock....
docs.lead_paragraph: LADIES' UNION AID SOCIETY.--The Ladies Union Aid Society, of the Methodist Eolscopal Church, for the benefit of aged and infirm members, held a donation party at the Institution in Forty-second-street. near the Eighth-avenue, yesterday, at 4 o'clock. The institution is designed to accommodate one hundred inmates, and there are at present but thirty old ladies in the house.

docs.abstract: Gold Medal for his services to the Crew of the Susquehanna
docs.lead_paragraph: That the true sailor never forgets a kindness has found at least one verification among the crew of the Susquthanna, or at least that portion who es aped the ravages of yellow fever on board of her, and who, by the self-forgetting generosity of a surgeon in the English Navy, reached their native homes in good health, after that vessel had lauded a large number of her crew at Port Royal, Jamaica. in March last.

docs.abstract: Report on the Wharves of the City
docs.lead_paragraph: The Board of Aldermen. The Board of Aldermen met last evening; President CLANCY in the chair. The following communication was received from the Street Commissioner; OFFICE OF THE STREET COMMISSIONER, NEW-YORK. June 7, 1858 I have the honor to submit the following condensed statement in reference to the present condition of whereas of the City.

docs.snippet: The most important matter in the Senate yesterday was a very interesting debate on the proposed increase of our Naval force by the addition of new steam sloops-of-war. The debate will be found reported quite fully elsewhere. It was participated in by...
docs.lead_paragraph: The most important matter in the Senate yesterday was a very interesting debate on the proposed increase of our Naval force by the addition of new steam sloops-of-war. The debate will be found reported quite fully elsewhere. It was participated in by all the leading Senators, and included in its range the late outrages committed by the British cruisers in the Gulf.

docs.snippet: Brooklyn Roman Catholic Orphan Asylum The building recently erected on Bedford avenue for the Brooklyn Roman Catholic Orphan Asylum for boys, was opened to the public for the first time last evening. The building is in the form of a double cross,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Brooklyn Roman Catholic Orphan Asylum The building recently erected on Bedford avenue for the Brooklyn Roman Catholic Orphan Asylum for boys, was opened to the public for the first time last evening. The building is in the form of a double cross, built of brick, with brown-stone trimmings, three-stories high, with large airy basement, sub-cellar and garret. Greatest length, 112 feet; depth,

docs.snippet: At Norristown, Pa., Friday, a young married man, named PHILIP BROWER, cut his thread of life by swallowing arsenic. Cause, the infidelity of his wife He left a letter, telling her to go and live with the man she loved better. In Morris County, Pa.,'...
docs.lead_paragraph: At Norristown, Pa., Friday, a young married man, named PHILIP BROWER, cut his thread of life by swallowing arsenic. Cause, the infidelity of his wife He left a letter, telling her to go and live with the man she loved better. In Morris County, Pa.,' on the 19th ult., a farmer, ISAAC VAN DUYNE, hung himself in his barn. Cause. disgust, because his daughter received the attentions of a young man whom he hated.

headline.main: A Short Lecture to our Judges upon the Better Improvement of their Time.
